intro: Centotheca malabarica, commonly known as the Malabar centotheca, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a prominent central disk. Centotheca malabarica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
